Package com.api.hub.ai.cache.impl

Class InMemoryCache<K,V>

java.lang.Object
com.api.hub.ai.cache.impl.InMemoryCache<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - the type of keys maintained by this cache
V - the type of mapped values
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cache<K,V>, CacheOperations<K,V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractCacheOperations
public abstract class InMemoryCache<K,V> extends Object implements CacheOperations<K,V>, Cache<K,V>
Abstract base class providing an in-memory cache implementation combining both Cache and CacheOperations interfaces for the AI-Agent Execution and Orchestration Platform.

This class maintains cache entries in a HashMap stored in RAM for fast access and implements basic cache operations such as save, get, put, and delete.

Upon modification of cache data (save, put, delete), it notifies the registered cache handlers by invoking CacheOperations.notifyCacheHandler(Object). This enables synchronization or additional processing hooks.

The get(Object) method attempts to retrieve the value from the in-memory map and, if the key is not found, triggers a cache population from the underlying data source by calling CacheOperations.source(). It then retries to return the fresh value.

Subclasses should implement the abstract methods of CacheOperations such as CacheOperations.refresh(), CacheOperations.clear(), CacheOperations.getLastRefreshTime(), and provide logic for cache synchronization with external or persistent cache servers.

This class forms a core part of the caching layer in the AI-agent framework, enabling high-performance, memory-based caching combined with pluggable synchronization mechanisms.
